Austria.name: UPC Austria GmbH
Austria.comment: (ISP) does not care what their customers do at all (unless you have a business connection)

Austria.name: A1(former Telekom Austria)
Austria.comment: Does not like Abuse (in any form) at all. Seems to give out customer data at alleged abuse. Not recommended but cheap.

Bulgaria.name: VPS.BG
Bulgaria.comment: They don't collect any personal info and you can pay in bitcoin.

Bulgaria.name: G-Core Labs
Bulgaria.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Canada.name: TekSavvy
Canada.comment: has a server-friendly Internet Use Policy (e.g., running a Tor relay) and has taken a stand in favor of net neutrality

Canada.name: oneprovider
Canada.comment: They are reselling dedicated servers in many locations around the world. Abuse handling differs depending on the provider from which they resell.

Canada.name: Vid√©otron Ltee
Canada.comment: No mention of Tor in ToS, relays and bridges seem allowed.

Canada.name: Servarica
Canada.comment: They allow running Tor relay but not Tor Exit.

Chile.name: VTR
Chile.comment: Middle relay is running in VTR network

Costa Rica.name: RackNation
Costa Rica.comment: Currently some Guard / Middle and exit nodes are running in RackNation network

Croatia.name: MAXKO Hosting
Croatia.comment: You can run anything you want as long (tor nodes are specifically allowed) as it's not a spam relay, botnet controller, they are pretty flexible regarding the packages they offer and will give a few days to test them before deciding. IPv6 is available (you have to ask) and the customer support is really helpful and will go the extra mile to help you. You will also be warned first if you do something wrong so you have a chance to fix it and warned again and again... The servers are pretty fast and there's usually discount codes available. They don't collect any personal info and you can pay in crypto.

France.name: Online.net
France.comment: The account holder is responsible for all the traffic going through theirs servers.

France.name: Gandi VPS
France.comment: They don't allow exit nodes according to the [relay mailinglist](https://lists.torproject.org/pipermail/tor-relays/2022-November/020868.html)

France.name: OVH Kimsufi
France.comment: Unmetered bandwidth @ 100mbps - "I will gladly explain this situation for you. Running a Tor exit node is strictly forbidden and can lead to the suspension and even termination of your server and account." Locations: FR,CA

France.name: Pulse Servers
France.comment: VPS uses OVH AS. You can build ANY kind tor relays.

France.name: Infomaniak
France.comment: ToS forbid setting up Tor relays, including middle relays.

Finland.name: Privex
Finland.comment: All node types permitted in Sweden, relays/bridges permitted in other regions. Tor friendly hosting provider who runs 3 relays and an exit themselves. Requires cryptocurrency to buy a server.

Finland.name: Njalla
Finland.comment: Privacy-focused, own domains on users' behalf, ensuring anonymity from central entities like ICANN, accept cryptocurrencies, and forward all abuse reports.

Germany.name: EUServ
Germany.comment: "Relays only allowed on dedicated Servers Prime64 and Pro64, Exit nodes only allowed on Prime64 and Pro64 with Pro-Option, own subnet, RIPE entry along with publicly visible abuse and police contact."

Germany.name: Keyweb
Germany.comment: "Everything that is in accordance with current jurisprudence is permitted on our servers."

Germany.name: Privex
Germany.comment: All node types permitted in Sweden, relays/bridges permitted in other regions. Tor friendly hosting provider who runs 3 relays and an exit themselves. Requires cryptocurrency to buy a server.

Germany.name: Hetzner
Germany.comment: Offers good dedicated root servers for a good price. Unmetered bandwidth on dedicated servers, 20tb on vps. "It is not a Problem, however, abuse reports can lead to a server lock" Locations: DE,FI

Germany.name: Contabo
Germany.comment: "The Provider is entitled to immediately block any webspace packages and servers that are being used to operate the ‚ÄúTOR‚Äù service, insofar as the Provider has become aware that the server or package is being used unlawfully."

Germany.name: Strato
Germany.comment: Support says all allowed, however they do not want illegal activities running on their servers.

Germany.name: PraHost
Germany.comment: "If there is any abuse notice received, you need to solve it in given time, else your IP will be blocked until you take any action"

Germany.name: Signaltransmitter
Germany.comment: "In principle, we do not limit our services apart from mining bitcoins"

Germany.name: Netcup
Germany.comment: 40-120TB bandwidth - Tor exit nodes allowed on VPS and rootservers - "Yes, it is. Everything is allowed that the T&Cs do not exclude."

Germany.name: VPS2Day
Germany.comment: Exit nodes prohibited due to terms of service

Germany.name: manitu
Germany.comment: "I'm sorry - even if the network has great added value for specific purposes, we have decided to prohibit Tor services on our network"

Germany.name: active-servers
Germany.comment: "Usually this leads to abuse mails, which only cause trouble ‚Äì but basically we have nothing against it"

Germany.name: UltraVPS
Germany.comment: "We are not the right host for your project"

Germany.name: G-Core Labs
Germany.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Germany.name: Venocix
Germany.comment: Running relay since 3 months without problems. Traffic is "fair use" and speed got limited after 10TB of traffic.

Hong Kong.name: G-Core Labs
Hong Kong.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Hungary.name: ServerAstra
Hungary.comment: They only say you should answer abuse requests in 24h. ISP has re-confirmed by e-mail that exit nodes are acceptable, with "strict" exit node policies. 4TB included traffic, extendable.

Hungary.name: G-Core Labs
Hungary.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Iceland.name: 1984Hosting
Iceland.comment: Free speech hoster. Only IPv4 AFAIK.

Iceland.name: FlokiNET
Iceland.comment: Sponsor enn.lu and saveyourprivacy exit nodes

Israel.name: BlueVPS
Israel.comment: They do not explicitly prohibit tor exits, but the upstream providers may cut off your internet given too many complaints.  This can be resolved by contacting support and getting a new IP.  Cheap with unmetered bandwidth, IPv4+IPv6, but network is highly unreliable.  Accepts crypto.

Italy.name: ArubaCloud /Aruba
Italy.comment: TOS generically indicate that the operator is responsible for all the activities on the machine. [Read more](https://balist.es/blog/2016/04/18/running-a-tor-exit-node-on-aruba-arubacloud-a-detailed-account/)

Italy.name: SelfServer by Enter
Italy.comment: Uncomfortable due to old CentOS 6.10, NATed IPv4-only networking, ports other than the well-known are filtered. Abuse complaints need to go through their support service

Italy.name: Revolution Hosting
Italy.comment: Exit nodes are allowed but they will be immediately terminated if any abuse complaint is issued. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Coingate supported.

Italy.name: G-Core Labs
Italy.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Latvia.name: Yourserver
Latvia.comment: Support team will allow relay/exit but TOR Traffic is throttled to 5Mbps speed. If your Exit relay receive too much complaints, they will ask to you to stop or otherwise they will suspend.

Latvia.name: Dataclub
Latvia.comment: Your Exit should use Reduced Exit Policy. IPv6 is optional. Unmetered traffic.

Lithuania.name: Baltic Servers
Lithuania.comment: All abuse mails they got yielded support tickets

Lithuania.name: Time4VPS
Lithuania.comment: "To not use Time4VPS services for any of the following: [...] Hosting public Proxy or Tor services;"

Luxembourg.name: BuyVM.net
Luxembourg.comment: New Tor rules [here](https://buyvm.net/acceptable-use-policy/#3). All relays are fine if you follow the steps. Notices are ignored. Unmetered bandwidth.

Luxembourg.name: G-Core Labs
Luxembourg.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Moldova.name: AlexHost
Moldova.comment: Unmetered bandwidth @ 100mbps "Tor exit relay is strictly forbidden on our company's servers"

Moldova.name: G-Core Labs
Moldova.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Netherlands.name: 100UP
Netherlands.comment: Use the Netherlands server for exit nodes, middle nodes can be ran on all servers

Netherlands.name: XS4ALL
Netherlands.comment: Abuse can result in temporary blocks, therefore they recommend to use an dedicated IP address for exit nodes

Netherlands.name: Crazy RDP
Netherlands.comment: Officially exits nodes are allowed according to the terms. However, at the first abuse report, service is terminated without refund

Netherlands.name: LiteServer
Netherlands.comment: Can pay with Bitcoin. While their AUP doesn't allow tor exit nodes (see [here](https://www.liteserver.nl/en/acceptable-usage-policy/)), they make an exception if your exit-node has a reduced exit policy. And you must leave a note to them that you are running a exit-node. "We allow tor exit nodes as long you run a limited exit policy (block SMTP) to avoid abuse.

Netherlands.name: i3D
Netherlands.comment: Allows also exits, if abuse is handled properly

Netherlands.name: Novogara
Netherlands.comment: Explicitly allows Tor exit nodes and forwards abuse/DCMA, but their network isn't the most stable. You need to email them for a custom offer. They also accept Bitcoin/UKash/CashU

Netherlands.name: Netrouting
Netherlands.comment: ISP has confirmed by e-mail that exit nodes are NOT acceptable.

Netherlands.name: SnelServer
Netherlands.comment: Abuse complaints must be responded to within 24 hours or the system automatically suspends your account until you do.

Netherlands.name: ChmuraNet
Netherlands.comment: Allows anonymous users to run tor exits. Abuse issues will be forwarded. Make sure to tell them that you're running an exit

Netherlands.name: NiceVPS.net
Netherlands.comment: Privacy registration with optional email, cryptocurrencies accepted, [Tor onion link](https://nicevpsb7u3vqpo5zhyahmvfi5tihon4gnh676ucmzpcyxwodeztr4yd.onion)

Netherlands.name: IncogNET
Netherlands.comment: You need to host a page on port 80 explaining that the server is a Tor Exit and use their reduced exit policy https://incognet.io/tor-exits

Netherlands.name: G-Core Labs
Netherlands.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Netherlands.name: VPSslim
Netherlands.comment: Don't pull over 2TB tx+rx bandwidth per day or the VPS will be locked (easily resolved by opening a ticket).  Use of AccountingMax highly recommended.  Extremely cheap with IPv4+IPv6, and unmetered fair use gigabit internet.  Accepts crypto.

Netherlands.name: HostSlick
Netherlands.comment: They allow exits. Have been running multiple for a few months without problems

New Zealand and Australia.name: Rimu hosting
New Zealand and Australia.comment: Have servers in N.Z.; Sydney; London; and Dallas. Locations may vary, but quite happy with the specific Oz/NZ query.

Norway.name: Terrahost
Norway.comment: Check the requirements for running a Tor exit node with them first https://terrahost.no/avtalebetingelser. May require a photo of an ID card or passport for account creation. Unmetered traffic.

Poland.name: cyber_Folks
Poland.comment: They had unpleasant experiences with exit relays so they don't allow it

Poland.name: Hitme.pl
Poland.comment: They block accounts if you receive an abuse report

Poland.name: statnet.pl
Poland.comment: Used to allow Tor-relays, but now is blocking Tor activity

Poland.name: IQ PL
Poland.comment: They allow running exit node on collocated dedicated server

Poland.name: Slask DataCenter
Poland.comment: They don't allow Tor traffic on their servers (anymore?)

Poland.name: Remote Admin
Poland.comment: You can install any software you want until it's legal and complies with polish law. They ask to properly and responsibly configure exit node to minimize abuse and they reserve rights to suspend your service if requested by law enforcement.

Poland.name: G-Core Labs
Poland.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Poland.name: HOSTIKO
Poland.comment: Allow payment with crypto. Also servers in Germany and Ukraine

Romania.name: MilesWeb
Romania.comment: Plans in Romania and also have data centers in USA and UK with 24x7 free support.

Romania.name: G-Core Labs
Romania.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Sweden.name: Dataclub
Sweden.comment: Your Exit should use Reduced Exit Policy. IPv6 is optional. Unmetered traffic.

Sweden.name: Privex
Sweden.comment: Tor friendly hosting provider who runs 3 relays and an exit themselves. Requires cryptocurrency to buy a server.

Sweden.name: Portlane
Sweden.comment: Previously provided connectivity for ThePirateBay, OpenBitTorrent tracker et al.  Handles abuse according to "Swedish praxis".

Sweden.name: Yourserver
Sweden.comment: Support team will allow relay/exit but TOR Traffic is throttled to 5Mbps speed. If your Exit relay receive too much complaints, they will ask to you to stop or otherwise they will suspend.

Sweden.name: Svea Hosting
Sweden.comment: They run an exit node themselves and write on their dedicated server page "It is perfect for [...] TOR Exit Nodes"

Switzerland.name: Solar Communications Gmbh
Switzerland.comment: "We allow to place Tor routers, but don't allow to place Tor exit nodes." This applies to all their partners, who actually sell Solar's services to the public, namely: [Server & cloud](https://server-cloud.com), [CoinsHost](https://coinshost.com), [Incloudibly](https://incloudibly.net), [Cloudcom](https://cloudc.me), [AtomDrive](https://atomdrive.net). Cryptocurrencies are accepted.

Switzerland.name: Swiss Made Host
Switzerland.comment: "Tor is not welcome on our network."

Switzerland.name: NiceVPS.net
Switzerland.comment: Privacy registration with optional email, cryptocurrencies accepted, [Tor onion link](https://nicevpsb7u3vqpo5zhyahmvfi5tihon4gnh676ucmzpcyxwodeztr4yd.onion)

Slovenia.name: Tus Hosting
Slovenia.comment: They just simply forward DMCA notices to us to handle (or ignore) them

Ukraine.name: Ukrainian Data Network
Ukraine.comment: free speech hoster, allows anything but spam/scam. Abuse always forwarded. IPv4 & IPv6. Accepts crypto. No strict data cap, 20TB is considered reasonable

Ukraine.name: G-Core Labs
Ukraine.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

Ukraine.name: HOSTIKO
Ukraine.comment: Allow payment with crypto. Also servers in Germany and Poland

United Kingdom.name: Gigatux
United Kingdom.comment: They actually run their own relay named Gigatux.  They also offer servers in the US, Germany, and Israel.

United Kingdom.name: Bitfolk
United Kingdom.comment: They are very knowledgable and understand Tor and its uses. They are hot on spam and abuse so advise changing the default exit (good idea in the UK anyhow). Any DMCA notices received were simply forwarded on without agro

United Kingdom.name: Hostworld
United Kingdom.comment: They are very responsive and understand the uses of Tor. They have a strict policy with abuse/spam and will not refund under their money back guarantee if abuse has been noticed. IPv4+IPv6 native support. Unmetered traffic.

US.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
US.comment: Expensive bandwidth, you WILL be charged extra after reaching 15GB.

US.name: Lumen (CenturyLink)
US.comment: [Home TOS doesn't explicitly ban "servers"](https://www.centurylink.com/legal/docs/Internet_Subscriber_Agreement_LQ_ENG.pdf), but unsure about exits.

US.name: BuyVM.net
US.comment: New Tor rules [here](https://buyvm.net/acceptable-use-policy/#3). All relays are fine if you follow the steps. Notices are ignored. Unmetered bandwidth.

US.name: Catalyst Host
US.comment: "If you are interested in hosting either, you can ask us about a dedicated server."

US.name: Cloudvider
US.comment: Prohibited Uses: to run a Tor Exit Node. They will cancel your account and claim it is a ToS violation, which requires you to pay out a 60-day notice.

US.name: Comcast
US.comment: To run an exit, you must be on a commercial subscription and must contact them first.

US.name: ChunkHost
US.comment: Questionable DMCA handling

US.name: Data Ideas (AlienData)
US.comment: AUP [here](https://dataideas.com/acceptable-use-policy.html). Notices are ignored. Unmetered bandwidth.

US.name: Datawagon
US.comment: Customers are forwarded abuse complaints to handle themselves

US.name: Hivelocity
US.comment: They are symphathetic, but do not want their IP space "polluted" by Tor abuse requests.

US.name: IncogNET
US.comment: You need to host a page on port 80 explaining that the server is a Tor Exit and use their reduced exit policy https://incognet.io/tor-exits

US.name: Linode
US.comment: "We allow Tor exits as long as they have a reduced exit policy." - I've used 10TB this month in total for all 3 of my exit nodes spread out in different locations. I've recieved 0 notices from Linode while using the free 100$ credits you get. I allow ports 53,80,443. My DE exit node is now the [2nd fastest](https://i.imgur.com/Owj6HkD.png) Linode relay, with UK third. I would recommend this host to use the free credits, but wouldn't really recommend paying as bandwidth is limited. Locations: US,CA,GB,DE,SG,JP,IN,AU

US.name: Oracle Cloud
US.comment: Offers generous free tier - 10TB free outbound bandwidth, I have ran a non exit relay for a few months with no problems, [as well as others](https://metrics.torproject.org/rs.html#search/as:AS31898). Note that they will terminate your account if you're suspicious and not provide reason, even on support chat, I've gotten an account banned simply for running a smokeping instance. (Pinging ip addresses to test network stability). Locations: US,CA,GB,DE,CH,NL,SA,UAE,BR,CL,JP,KR,AU,IN

US.name: OVHcloud
US.comment: Unmetered bandwidth in non asia locations. - "I will gladly explain this situation for you. Running a Tor exit node is strictly forbidden and can lead to the suspension and even termination of your server and account." Locations: US,CA,FR,DE,PL,GB,SG

US.name: Oplink.net
US.comment: Specifically Prohibited Abuse: hosting of any Tor exit relays or nodes.

US.name: Psychz Networks
US.comment: Very Exit friendly. Standard Tor response will resolve abuse issues.

US.name: PulseServers
US.comment: Exit-friendly.

US.name: Astound Broadband
US.comment: The [acceptable use policy](https://www.astound.com/policies-disclaimers/acceptable-use-policy/) disallows "servers" and "proxies".

US.name: Vultr
US.comment: When asked directly they will claim they do support Tor exits but will pull the rug out from under you later on. This has happened to at least two exit operators.

US.name: ChicagoVPS
US.comment: Tor bridge/relay is allowed on the whole VPS range. Any VPS running Exit nodes will be suspended without prior notice.

US.name: MonkeyBrains
US.comment: Only offers colocation, no cheap VPS option.

US.name: Universal Hosting
US.comment: Charges, and suspends customers. [More info](https://universal-hosting.com/abuse)

US.name: Microsoft Azure
US.comment: Expensive bandwidth, you WILL be charged extra after reaching 15GB.

US.name: G-Core Labs
US.comment: They don't allow exits and will suspend your active services and restrict your access to the account if they receive abuse messages. KVM VPS. IPv4+IPv6 native support. * Gnu/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows server supported. Unmetered traffic.

US.name: Tornado VPS
US.comment: Allows exits [with a reduced exit policy](https://tornadovps.com/faq).

US.name: ReliableSite
US.comment: While not mentioned in the AUP, has said they "disallow" Tor even if you announce your own IP ranges.

US.name: GoDaddy
US.comment: At least with a reduced exit policy alongside blocking SSH, very Tor Exit friendly on VPS. Unmetered bandwidth.
